nodes.definition: A recursive unit of organization that functions simultaneously as an autonomous whole and as a dependent part of a larger aggregate (a Holarchy). It possesses a Markov Blanket separating internal state from external states, interacting only through active outputs and sensory inputs.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as the `Holon` trait in `crates/apm2-holon/src/traits.rs`, defining the agent contract (`intake`, `execute_episode`, `should_stop`). The `EpisodeController` in `crates/apm2-holon/src/episode/controller.rs` manages the execution loop, enforcing the Markov Blanket via `EpisodeContext`.

nodes.definition: A time-bounded, scope-bounded, revocable authorization to perform work or access resources. It serves as the primary mechanism for Bounded Authority.
nodes.operationalization: Represented by the `Lease` struct (`crates/apm2-holon/src/resource/lease.rs`) containing `LeaseScope` and `expiration`. Enforced by the `LeaseValidator` trait in `crates/apm2-daemon/src/protocol/dispatch.rs` during tool execution.

nodes.definition: A quantified allowance of resources (Compute, Tokens, Time, Tool Calls) attached to a Lease. It enforces hard stops to prevent runaway agents.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as the `EpisodeBudget` struct in `crates/apm2-daemon/src/episode/budget.rs` with 4D limits (tokens, time, actions, episodes). Checked by `EpisodeController` during execution cycles.

nodes.definition: A Holonic Verification Protocol that enforces quality, security, and compliance standards. It transforms subjective reviews into objective, machine-verifiable proofs (Receipts).
A specialized Gate that controls the entry of ChangeSets into the Forge. It ensures that only work meeting strict criteria (e.g., passing AAT, no security regressions) is admitted for merging.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as `AdmissionGate` in `crates/apm2-core/src/cac/admission.rs`. Generates `AdmissionReceipt` upon success.

nodes.definition: The Topology of Truth. An append-only, cryptographically verifiable log of all significant events. It serves as the single source of truth for the system state.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as a SQLite WAL store via `Ledger` struct (`crates/apm2-core/src/ledger/storage.rs`) storing hash-chained `EventRecord`s. Provides a `LedgerReader` for concurrent access and `LedgerBackend` trait for abstraction.

nodes.definition: The atomic unit of storage in the Ledger. Contains the event payload, sequence ID, and cryptographic proofs.
nodes.operationalization: Defined as `EventRecord` struct in `crates/apm2-core/src/ledger/storage.rs`, containing `seq_id`, `event_hash`, `prev_hash`, `signature`, and the serialized event payload.

nodes.definition: A Bounded Context Window of execution for a Holon. It represents a discrete unit of work (perceive-reason-act-evaluate) within a strictly enforced resource budget.
nodes.operationalization: Managed by `EpisodeController` (`crates/apm2-holon/src/episode/controller.rs`) and `EpisodeRuntime` (`crates/apm2-daemon/src/episode/runtime.rs`). Lifecycle events like `EpisodeStarted` are emitted to the ledger.

nodes.definition: A pre-compiled, content-addressed, and bounded view of artifacts required for execution. It enforces Context Discipline by serving as a read allowlist.
nodes.operationalization: Defined by `ContextPackSpec` (`crates/apm2-core/src/cac/pack_spec.rs`) and `ContextPackManifest`. The `ContextPackCompiler` resolves dependencies into a deterministic view.

nodes.definition: A security model where authority is represented by unforgeable tokens (capabilities). It eliminates ambient authority by requiring explicit capability presentation.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented via `Capability` structs (`crates/apm2-daemon/src/episode/capability.rs`) and `CapabilityManifest`. The `CapabilityValidator` ensures tools are only invoked with valid capabilities.

nodes.definition: A Cryptographic Proof of Work capturing immutable output. It consists of a CAS artifact and signed metadata linking it to a Work item.
nodes.operationalization: Represented by `Evidence` struct (`crates/apm2-core/src/evidence/state.rs`) and categorized by `EvidenceCategory`. Stored in CAS and referenced by `EvidencePublished` events.

nodes.definition: A machine-verifiable proof of an outcome (e.g., Gate Pass, Tool Execution). It binds authority/validity to specific evidence.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as `GateReceipt` (`crates/apm2-core/src/evidence/receipt.rs`), `ToolReceipt`, and `SummaryReceipt`. Must be signed via `ReceiptSigner` and hash-linked.

nodes.definition: A proof that a ChangeSet was successfully merged into the canonical branch. It serves as the authoritative record of code evolution, binding the specific Commit ID to the approved ChangeSet.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as `MergeReceipt` in `crates/apm2-core/src/fac/merge_receipt.rs`. Recorded on the ledger as a `MergeReceipt` event.

nodes.definition: A proof that a machine verifier or approved reviewer family has approved a ChangeSet. It captures verifier identity, the specific artifacts reviewed, and the verdict.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as `ReviewReceiptRecorded` in `crates/apm2-core/src/fac/review_receipt.rs`. Includes a `ReviewReceiptRecordedBuilder` for construction.

nodes.definition: A rigorous, machine-driven verification process where ChangeSets are subjected to a defined `AatSpec` (suite of tests) to produce an `AatGateReceipt`.
A discrete, privileged capability exposed to agents. It is the only mechanism for affecting the outside world, mediated by Policy and Leases.
nodes.operationalization: Defined via Protocol Buffers in `crates/apm2-core/src/tool/apm2.tool.v1.rs`. Handled by `ToolHandler` implementations in `crates/apm2-daemon/src/episode/tool_handler.rs`, which enforce policy checks.

nodes.definition: A content-addressed representation of local, uncommitted changes relative to a pinned base state. Allows dirty state to be auditable.
nodes.operationalization: Modeled as a patch artifact managed by `WorkspaceManager` (`crates/apm2-daemon/src/episode/workspace.rs`). Used in `ContextPack`s for dirty execution.

nodes.definition: The atomic unit of code evolution. Represents a proposed transition strictly bound to a Plan and validated by Gates.
nodes.operationalization: A `Work` item type (`WorkType::ChangeSet`). Tracks the lifecycle of a code change on the ledger via `ChangeSetBundleV1` (`crates/apm2-core/src/fac/changeset_bundle.rs`).

nodes.definition: A specialized agent role responsible for Work Decomposition and Delegation. Manages the lifecycle of complex goals by spawning sub-holons.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented via `RestartCoordinator` (`crates/apm2-core/src/session/restart_coordinator.rs`) and specific `Holon` logic that delegates work via `EpisodeController`.

nodes.definition: The APM2 Kernel. Manages state, enforces policy, and orchestrates the IPC protocol between agents and the environment.
nodes.operationalization: The `apm2-daemon` crate. Holds `DaemonState` (`crates/apm2-daemon/src/state.rs`) and runs the `SessionDispatcher` (`crates/apm2-daemon/src/protocol/session_dispatch.rs`) to handle IPC.

nodes.definition: A Structured Defect. A typed data object representing a specific issue (Security, Lint) detected by a Gate.
nodes.operationalization: Struct with Category, Severity, Location, and a `FindingSignature` (`crates/apm2-core/src/fac/echo_trap.rs`) for recurrence tracking.

nodes.definition: The intent structure preceding a ChangeSet. Captures requirements and design decisions, hashed to prevent drift.
nodes.operationalization: A `Work` item (`WorkType::PrdRefinement`) producing a spec snapshot hash (`crates/apm2-core/src/work/state.rs`).

nodes.definition: Governance as Code. A system of rules enforcing Default-Deny constraints on agent behavior (Tools, Network, Filesystem).
The OS-level execution unit of a Holon. Managed by a Supervisor and governed by a ProcessSpec.
nodes.operationalization: Managed via `ProcessHandle` and configured by `ProcessSpec` in `crates/apm2-core/src/process/mod.rs`.

nodes.definition: A pure function that transitions state by applying an Event. Ensures determinism and auditability.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as the `Reducer` trait (`crates/apm2-core/src/reducer/traits.rs`). Used to rebuild state from the Ledger. Can be checkpointed via `CheckpointStore` (`crates/apm2-core/src/reducer/checkpoint.rs`).

nodes.definition: A mechanism to save snapshots of Reducer state to avoid replaying the entire ledger from genesis.
The Temporal Continuity of an agent's work. Spans episodes and restarts, maintained via SessionState and Ledger replay.
nodes.operationalization: Tracked by `SessionState` (`crates/apm2-core/src/session/state.rs`). Recoverable via `RestartCoordinator`. Managed by `SessionDispatcher`.

nodes.definition: The central component in the Daemon that routes IPC messages to the appropriate Session implementation.
A verified, canonical projection of the Ledger at a specific anchor. Reduces replay cost while preserving provenance.
An infrastructure role managing Lifecycle, Budget Enforcement, and Recovery. Acts as the OS for Holons.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented by `Supervisor` struct (`crates/apm2-core/src/supervisor/mod.rs`). Manages process handles and enforces leases.

nodes.definition: A non-authoritative Pulse Plane for lossy event notifications, designed to accelerate UX and reduce polling by deriving 'pulses' from the authoritative Truth Plane (Ledger + CAS).
nodes.operationalization: Implemented via `PulseEnvelopeV1` (proto), `PulsePublisher` (`crates/apm2-daemon/src/protocol/pulse_outbox.rs`), and resource governance logic (`crates/apm2-daemon/src/protocol/resource_governance.rs`).

nodes.definition: The protocol substrate defining the time model for APM2. It prohibits wall-clock authority in favor of explicit, verifiable clocks (LedgerTime, MonotonicTicks, CausalTime).
A clock that combines physical time with logical ticks to capture causality across distributed systems.

The authority-bearing identity of an acting holon. For boundary-crossing authority decisions it MUST resolve to a self-certifying HolonIdV1 (or a lossless mapping), proven by IdentityProofV1 against an authenticated directory head.
nodes.operationalization: Bound during `hsi.session.open` identity verification flow and propagated into EpisodeEnvelope/receipts as `actor_id` commitments.

nodes.definition: The atomic unit of work request/initiation, typically upstream of a Plan. Represents the "Spec-of-Request".
The agent-side stateful representation of a unit of work (ticket, plan, changeset) tracking its lifecycle attempts.
A node or mechanism that mediates connectivity between Holons to enforce outbound-only security boundaries.
The mandatory protocol negotiation (Hello/HelloAck) required before any IPC or network exchange.
A calculated artifact that determines the "Blast Radius" of a change, used to assign Risk Tiers.
The authoritative store for Protocol Buffer schemas and version mappings, enforcing semantic typing.
A subsystem that monitors codebase complexity and churn to generate proactive maintenance recommendations (Refactoring Tickets).
Data structures that guarantee eventual convergence without global synchronization, used for the Data Plane.
A machine-readable counterexample that falsifies an intent predicate or contract. It includes an evidence bundle, structured findings, and replay instructions.
nodes.operationalization: Implemented as `DefectRecord` in `crates/apm2-holon/src/defect.rs` and the `DefectRecorded` event in `events/apm2.kernel.v1.rs`.

nodes.definition: A deterministic identifier computed from normalized finding fields (category, rule ID, subsystem, location) used to cluster recurrent defects and trigger countermeasures.
The authoritative coordination plane comprising work-object specs, durable event records, and deterministic projections. It is the 'factory floor' for agent activity.
nodes.operationalization: Abstract concept realized by the integration of `Ledger`, `CAS`, `WorkObject` state machines, and the `Daemon` event loop.

nodes.definition: An approved Plan specification snapshot bound by a content digest. It serves as the immutable reference for downstream implementation and verification.
nodes.operationalization: Realized as a `Work` object with `WorkType::PrdRefinement` or `RfcRefinement` that has been approved and hashed.

nodes.definition: A deterministic representation of specification content (YAML, attachments, schema versions), canonicalized and hashed to provide stable identity.
nodes.operationalization: Part of the `Work` state in `crates/apm2-core/src/work/state.rs`, stored as `spec_snapshot_hash`.

nodes.definition: An execution instance of a Gate against a Plan or ChangeSet, producing a decision and a bounded set of Findings. It must emit a verifiable receipt.
nodes.operationalization: Represented by the `GateRunCompleted` event in `documents/rfcs/RFC-0015/06_ticket_decomposition.yaml` (and likely protocol definitions).

nodes.definition: Planned work to prevent the recurrence of a FindingSignature by modifying system guardrails. Validated by evidence of reduced recurrence.
nodes.operationalization: A specific `WorkType` (conceptual) or a `Ticket` triggered by recurrence analysis in `RefactorRadar` or similar subsystems.

nodes.definition: The only legal path for capabilities to cross a holonic boundary. It binds delegator->delegatee authority with typed budgets, stop predicates, expiry, and view/context commitments. Delegation is valid only as a strict subset (meet) of parent authority across all constrained dimensions.
nodes.operationalization: Conceptual mechanism defined in `unified_theory.json` (MECH-PERMEABILITY-RECEIPT) and RFC-0020 ยง8.3; consumed during handshake/capability exchange and bound into episode/receipt artifacts.

nodes.definition: The authenticated envelope for authoritative facts/roots. It may authenticate one artifact hash directly or a Merkle batch root with inclusion proofs, and it binds ledger/quorum/time anchors for freshness semantics.
nodes.operationalization: Defined by `apm2.authority_seal.v1` in RFC-0020; used by receipt verification paths and proof-compression workflows.

nodes.definition: A proof-carrying identity artifact binding certificate hashes, directory head commitment, and authenticated-dictionary membership proof so verifiers avoid linear scans.
A machine-checkable policy defining maximum staleness and fail-closed actions by risk tier for identity heads, policy digests, and stop-state authority.
nodes.operationalization: Defined by `apm2.freshness_policy.v1` in RFC-0020 and applied during identity/policy/stop verification before actuation.

nodes.definition: An explicit escalation event for high-entropy specification gaps requiring bounded machine re-verification. Optional/out-of-profile for strict formalist deployments; superseded by ReverificationRequest naming where enabled.
The digest-first communication standard for inter-holon messages. It enforces `Discovery -> Handshake -> Work -> Evidence -> Governance` channel progression with explicit channel-class semantics.
nodes.operationalization: Conceptual standard defined in `unified_theory.json` (MECH-HOLON-MESH-PROTOCOL). Partially implemented by the `apm2-daemon` protocol.

nodes.definition: An operational and trust boundary that hosts a set of holons with a local ledger namespace, CAS, and policy. It supports federation via anti-entropy.
nodes.operationalization: Conceptual unit of sharding defined in `unified_theory.json` (Federation Model).

nodes.definition: The mandatory fail-closed interface invariants for authority, canonicalization, bounded decoding, typed quantities, freshness, and proof-carrying effects.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 0.1 and treated as mandatory substrate-level constraints.

nodes.definition: The rule that daemon-enforced semantics are operational truth and interface meaning must remain stable under transport/projection changes.
The required verification predicates for claiming that a world effect is authoritative.
Unitful, machine-checkable quantitative budget fields used for enforcement and coordination.
The requirement that verified identity and freshness witnesses are bound to the active daemon session and cannot be mutated by client claims.
The side-effecting tool contract requiring idempotency keys plus precondition guards for at-most-once kernel effects under at-least-once delivery.
A typed, budgeted escalation request object (context, capability, oracle) emitted when local execution cannot safely continue.
The mandatory set of machine-detectable contract and containment failures that must become structured defects.
A receipt proving that a lossy transformation preserves verifiable audit semantics.
The requirement that lossy summaries expose deterministic selectors sufficient to retrieve supporting evidence slices for material claims.
The cross-plane budget admission regime enforcing per-episode, per-cell, and per-relay limits with deny-and-receipt behavior on exhaustion.
The staged governance progression (observe->warn->enforce) with objective evidence gates and canary-controlled blast radius.
Time-bounded safety objective requiring emergency stop uncertainty to fail-closed and stop propagation to meet strict latency targets.
The effect-severity ladder controlling gate strength, isolation floor, and freshness/containment strictness.
Cross-cell coordination model using digest-first anti-entropy and receipt-bound imports without requiring global total order for all data-plane facts.
Static contract artifact enumerating callable syscalls/routes, schemas, and semantics for a daemon instance.
Dynamic authority artifact describing delegated capabilities, scopes, budgets, and constraints for an execution context.
Immutable execution commitment binding risk tier, budgets, stop conditions, reproducibility pins, and manifest/view commitments.
Typed adapter-to-daemon tool intent object used to prevent raw string tool actuation paths.
Canonical envelope for inter-holon mesh messages with class/channel commitments and replay-safe identifiers.
Receipt proving cross-cell admission of imported authoritative facts under local trust/freshness policy.
Compact pointer object for authoritative receipt verification via direct receipt hash or batched proof path.
Versioned freshness contract defining risk-tier staleness bounds and fail-closed actions for authority checks.
Versioned cross-holon delegation receipt binding strict-subset authority transfer to budgets, stop conditions, expiry, and view commitments.
Versioned integrity-proof envelope for authoritative artifacts and batched roots with ledger/quorum/time anchors.
Adapter capability and behavior profile hashed into session/envelope contracts for drift detection.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 rollout stages section 10 (S0.5).

nodes.definition: Typed authority lattice vector used to compute strict-subset delegation meets.
Root-of-roots commitment for hierarchical receipt batch forests in proof-compression pipelines.
Typed escalation request for additional capabilities or scope widening under policy/governance review.
Cell identity certificate binding trust domain and policy-root verification material.
Canonical genesis object whose digest defines stable self-certifying cell identity.
Self-certifying cell identity derived from canonical genesis commitments.
Bounded, typed incremental context transfer object used to extend a committed context view.
nodes.operationalization: Defined by HSI context interfaces and commitments.

nodes.definition: Deterministic selector index enabling bounded lookup and zoom-in for context claims.
Typed escalation request for additional selectors/slices when current context is insufficient.
Receipt recording objective inputs and rationale for repeated/high-impact coordination escalations.
Bounded authenticated-directory proof object for identity membership/non-membership checks.
Receipt artifact capturing disaster-recovery/chaos drill execution and outcomes.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 business continuity sections.

nodes.definition: Freshness commitment object anchoring anti-rollback/anti-equivocation semantics across federation links.
Index artifact for deterministic retrieval of evidence chunks/selectors under digest commitments.
Proof object showing that a specific fact digest is included under an authenticated root commitment.
Root commitment object for authoritative fact sets used by batched verification.
CAS artifact binding reproducibility-critical digests used by episode and receipt commitments.
Certificate binding holon identity commitments and operational keys within a cell trust domain.
Authenticated directory head commitment enabling bounded, cacheable identity verification.
Canonical genesis object whose digest defines stable self-certifying holon identity.
Self-certifying holon identity derived from cell and holon genesis commitments.
Shared multiproof format for verifying many identity memberships under a single directory head.
Verifier-economics contract declaring proof byte/depth bounds and operational verification ceilings.
Proof-carrying identity object binding certificates, directory head hash, and membership proof with as-of anchor.
Receipt proving acceptance of imported remote facts under local trust and policy constraints.
nodes.operationalization: Defined by HSI federation admission patterns.

nodes.definition: Canonical descriptor object for quorum/threshold verifier keysets.
Self-certifying digest identifier for a canonical KeySetDescriptorV1.

Versioned structured request object for bounded machine re-verification at specification-gap decision points. Optional/out-of-profile for strict formalist deployments; superseded by ReverificationRequestV1 naming where enabled.
Canonical digest identifier for a verifying public key used across boundary-bearing identity objects.
Descriptor artifact defining the composition and verification contract of a receipt batch.
Multiproof object for amortized verification of many receipt inclusions under a shared root.
Role-level behavioral/spec commitment artifact hashed into envelope and adapter/profile bindings.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 stage 0.5 binding rules.

nodes.definition: Signed binding from operational identity key material to short-lived session key material.
Bounded selector index over tool execution logs for deterministic retrieval without raw log flooding.
nodes.operationalization: Defined by HSI receipt/log indexing constraints.

nodes.definition: Cryptographic commitment that binds a bounded context/view projection to authoritative ledger state.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in HSI context and permeability binding semantics.

nodes.definition: Any action that can modify state outside ephemeral agent cognition and therefore requires receipt-backed proof.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.3 as the boundary of authoritative effect semantics.

nodes.definition: Replay-stability class on an episode that controls policy strictness for reproducibility and actuation.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.2.2 and bound into EpisodeEnvelope commitments.

nodes.definition: Cross-holon communication pattern that transmits hashes and deterministic selectors instead of raw payload propagation.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.4 and used by HMP, anti-entropy, and evidence zoom-in flows.

nodes.definition: Canonical algorithm-tagged digest identity used for cross-boundary artifact addressing and verification.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.5 with binary and text forms and mandatory algorithm identity.

nodes.definition: Deterministic serialization contract for signed or hashed artifacts that removes parser variance and unknown-field ambiguity.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.5.1 for protobuf and JSON canonical forms.

nodes.definition: Hash preimage namespacing by artifact kind and schema version to prevent cross-type confused-deputy reuse.
Strict canonical grammar and parsing rules for identity text forms that cross holonic boundaries.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.7.5b with ABNF and fail-closed parser requirements.

nodes.definition: Mandatory head-cache and proof-cache rules that amortize identity verification at high fanout.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.7.7c with invalidation behavior under revocation and freshness upgrades.

nodes.definition: Ordered interaction contract requiring discovery, handshake, work, evidence, and governance phases with channel-class validity checks.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 2.1.1 and enforced as message-order and class constraints.

nodes.definition: Five-channel decomposition (Discovery, Handshake, Work, Evidence, Governance) that constrains boundary traffic and truth semantics.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 2.3 as mandatory channel-class structure.

nodes.definition: Typed communication class that determines admissible payloads, authority semantics, and replay constraints.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 2.3 and embedded in HMP envelopes.

nodes.definition: Federation rule that truth-plane control facts and data-plane evidence blobs have distinct replication, verification, and admission semantics.
Receiving-cell proof that imported cross-cell bytes were verified and admitted into the local truth plane.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 2.4.0b as mandatory for authoritative cross-cell ingestion.

nodes.definition: Directory merge law where revocation dominates concurrent active state unless explicit later re-admission is proven.
Pull-bounded reconciliation protocol for ledger ranges and CAS pointers under reordering, duplication, and Byzantine peers.
Cross-cell trust initialization model that admits authority only via pinned or federation-certified policy-root bindings.
Rule that federation admission requires both trust-chain validity and freshness validity, with tiered fail-closed behavior under uncertainty.
Authoritative externally visible execution semantics defined by admitted ledger facts, referenced CAS artifacts, and governance actions.
Transformation that removes internal holonic boundaries while preserving authoritative facts and delegation commitments.
Required equivalence condition that composed recursion traces and flattened traces remain weakly bisimilar up to admissible renaming and batching.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 2.6.3 and required for ratchet promotion evidence.

nodes.definition: Composition law requiring admitted optimizations to preserve observational semantics under identity, composition, and flattening naturality.
Contained untrusted execution environment with no ambient authority where all side effects must transit daemon-mediated tools.
Content-addressed profile describing process isolation, filesystem/network policy, executable allowlists, and environment scrubbing for a capsule.
Fail-closed boundary that allows context reads only through committed manifest/hash allowlists and denies covert read channels.
Authority allowlist object for context reads that binds entry hashes, access levels, and zoom permissions.
Typed actuation class that defines allowed operations, argument schema, and receipt semantics without ambient shell authority.
Validation discipline for hostile argument handling, path normalization, ref constraints, and bounded output in mediated tools.
Monotone integrity-label structure for untrusted to integrity-proven evidence propagation and gating.
Non-decreasing classification model for evidence and outputs unless explicitly lowered by signed declassification.
Boundary policy that jointly enforces minimum integrity and maximum confidentiality on outbound flows.
Signed justification artifact required to lower confidentiality classification across boundaries.
nodes.operationalization: Introduced as a stage deliverable in RFC-0020 section 10 (Stage 6).

nodes.definition: Merkle-batched receipt authentication model that amortizes signature or quorum verification across high-volume effects.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 9.5 with AuthoritySeal and pointer proof requirements.

nodes.definition: Summary artifact information-economics contract requiring explicit rate, source size, loss profile, and selector coverage declarations.
Asymptotic and practical verifier workload targets requiring O(1) signature checks per batch family and bounded logarithmic hash work.
Directory commitment kind for 256-bit sparse Merkle authenticated dictionaries.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.7.7 as an allowed HolonDirectoryHead directory kind.

nodes.definition: Directory commitment kind for key-compressed authenticated trie dictionaries.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.7.7 as an allowed and recommended default directory kind at scale.

nodes.definition: Directory proof encoding kind for compressed sparse Merkle proofs.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.7.7a as an allowed DirectoryProof kind.

nodes.definition: Directory proof encoding kind for compressed Patricia trie proofs.
nodes.operationalization: Defined in RFC-0020 section 1.7.7a as an allowed DirectoryProof kind.

nodes.definition: A digest-first map of trust assertions between cells, keyed by receipts and commitments that prove who delegated authority, under which policy version, and with what validity window.
nodes.operationalization: Built from import/permeability/admission receipts and periodically reconciled checkpoint commitments; used to validate cross-cell trust without ambient assumptions.

nodes.definition: A signed coverage map proving revocation propagation status by cell, scope, and risk tier, including latency and stale-authority denial evidence.
nodes.operationalization: Aggregates revocation propagation receipts into a deterministic coverage structure checked against revocation SLO policy before high-risk actuation.
